result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy J Pryor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 6.22.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6.22.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN: RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVE CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

- signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35 Judge Rosa. os
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 6.22.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6.22.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
April 21, 2015 @ 1:30P in BR 7, CH Rm 629 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 03-11-2015 at 08:30 am.
SUBPOENA RECALLED

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court. Defendant Jimmy Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial date is vacated. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for 01-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties are being notified that effective December 1, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests new counsel. Defense heard. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defendant's request to have Attorney Lamke removed as counsel. 
Defense requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 1-15-2015 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 1-26-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 9/18/2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for STATUS on 8/19/2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives defendants appearance for todays proceedings. Defendant has new charges pending in Ozaukee County.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant wants a new date for plea as he is awaiting the results of his revocation hearing. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/28/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Jimmy J Pryor not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held, defense requested projected guilty plea.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in custody.  Denis Stingl for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Ptaszek-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF4658 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Jimmy J Pryor in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
